name: ormExecuteQuery
description: Runs the HQL on the default data source specified for the application.

params.name: params
params.description: A struct or array of query params.

params.name: unique
params.description: If true returns a single entity instead of an array.

params.name: queryoptions
params.description: A struct with possible keys: ignorecase, maxResults, offset, cacheable, timeout, datasource

examples.title: HQL query syntax
examples.code:
<cfscript>
   employees = ormExecuteQuery("from Employees");
   employees = ormExecuteQuery("from Employees where age > 40");
   employeeObj = ormExecuteQuery("from Employees where EmployeeID =1", true);
   firstNameArray = ormExecuteQuery("select FirstName from Employees");
   numberOfEmps = ormExecuteQuery("select count(*) from Employees");
   firstName = ormExecuteQuery("select FirstName from Employees where EmployeeID = 1", true);
   employees = ormExecuteQuery("from Employees", false, {offset=5, maxresults=10, timeout=5});
</cfscript>

examples.title: HQL query syntax with generic parameterized input
examples.code:
<cfscript>
    employees = ormExecuteQuery("from Employee where age > ?", [40]);
    employeeObj = ormExecuteQuery("from Employee where EmployeeID = ?", [1], true);
    employees = ormExecuteQuery("from Employee where age > ? and age < ?", [40, 80]);
</cfscript>

examples.title: HQL query syntax with named parameter input
examples.code:
<cfscript>
   USEmployees = ormExecuteQuery("from Employee where country=:country and citizenship=:country", {country='USA'});
   orderDetail = ormExecuteQuery("from Orders where OrderID=:orderid and ProductID=:productid", {orderid=1, productid=901}, true);
</cfscript>
